titleStmt.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, January 17, 1899

bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.note: Index Bureau Dept of State Rec'd Feb 20 '99
div1.p:
No. 16 Consulate Series.
Legation of the United States
Monrovia Liberia,
Jan. 17, 1899.
I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence, that I have herewith transmitted, to the Secretary of State a Photograph of United States Legation at Monrovia.
As the second floor of the Legation is not occupied, neither as offices nor archives of the Legation, I do hereby ask permission to occupy it as a resident for the Minister and his family.

I have the honor to be your obedient servant
Owen L. W. Smith
To Hon. David J. Hill,
Assistant Secretary of State

1 Letter-Philadelphia Com. Museum, Philadelphia.
1 "The Defiance Machine Works," Defiance Ohio
1 S. B. Spring & Bro. Leather M'fg Co. Belleville N.J.
1 Dickinson, & Co, #10 Wall St New York.
Note of Advice relative to said letters.
